text: China is big business its economy is
almost 50 times larger than it was in
1980 it's become the world's second
largest but what does this mean for the
rest of the world china is the world's
factory it produces a lot of our goods
and the bits we need to make our goods
it's become a global powerhouse for
example it makes 70% of the world's air
conditioner 58 percent of the world
shoes it's also the world's largest
printer of Bibles
so if China slows down businesses all
over the world slow down a bigger
economy means richer people
turns out China's growing middle class
has pretty expensive tastes a third of
global spending on luxury brands comes
from the Chinese that means some pretty
famous names dink Louboutin you think
Chanel they're all affected a lot by
what happens in China for example a
fixable Burberry's revenues last year
came from China technology firms have
also cashed in on China's thirst for
gadgets around 1 in 7 iPhone shipped
around the world goes to someone from
China with more than 1.4 billion people
living there it's not surprising that
it's the world's largest energy consumer
and a huge buyer of things that oil
spill and copper then this tourism the
tiny spent two hundred and seventy seven
billion dollars traveling overseas in
2018 just to give you some perspective
that's around 1/5 of total spending
abroad China is also a big investor in
projects around the world they're
building railways in Kenya and Ethiopia
bridges in Croatia roads and Pakistan
during the last financial crisis it
became the investor of last resort
keeping things going when everyone else
was too weak in 2009 it kept Australia
out of recession when most of the rest
of the world was in it
so if China can't keep spending in
another global downturn the recovery
will take longer but many of these
projects and investments don't come for
free China is also using them to build
political influence all over the world
it's true that China's financial system
does remain closed meaning the
like you and me cop moves money in and
out of the country luck in the US or the
UK but the direction of travel is clear
a more opening Chinese economy means its
fortunes are increasingly tied to the
rest of the world and the other way
around
you
